definition: to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement
article/commodity/product/goods/kind/grade/rank/character/disposition/nature/temperament/variety/to taste sth/to sample/to criticize/to comment/to judge/to size up/fret (on a guitar or lute)

sentences.english: Chicken soup is often thought to be a healthy dish (prepared by a family member) and (given to us) when we are sick.
sentences.chinese: 雞湯常被認爲是我們生病時，家人爲我們準備的補品。

sentences.english: To use this skill you need Concentration tonics which can be bought at item store.
sentences.chinese: 要使用此技能需要濃度滋補品，可買的物品存儲。

sentences.english: This tonic, strengthening the loins and invigorating the kidney , is the first choice for the nephrotics.
sentences.chinese: 本補膏健腎壯腰，腎虧病人的首選補品。

sentences.english: When it comes to supplements, you should ask the same questions. Those things apply -- talk to your physician.
sentences.chinese: 一旦說到補品，你也應該問同樣的問題。

sentences.english: But supplements do offer an easy, just-in-case form of health insurance.
sentences.chinese: 但是，補品的確很方便地爲您的健康增加了一道保險。

sentences.english: Debate has raged over whether taking supplements might provide the body with an extra boost.
sentences.chinese: 攝取補品是否能夠增強體質的爭論已經熾熱化。

sentences.english: Strictly speaking, "tonic" has the sub-tonic and tonic.
sentences.chinese: 嚴格地講，“補藥”有補藥和補品之分。

sentences.english: She advised consulting with doctors first about taking supplements.
sentences.chinese: 她勸服用補品的人應首先諮詢醫生。

sentences.english: It may also interact with some medications or supplements.
sentences.chinese: 它也可能會與一些藥物或補品相互作用。

sentences.english: Cordyceps sinensis (Berk. ) Sacc. , a parasitic fungus, is highly valued in China as a tonic food and herbal medicine for centuries.
sentences.chinese: 冬蟲夏草是一種藥食兩用的珍貴滋補品和中藥材。

sentences.english: This shop has for sale every kind of tonic that helps stimulate appetite and digestion.
sentences.chinese: 各種開胃消食的補品，本店應有盡有。
人蔘是一種強力的補品。

sentences.english: Sea air is Nature's best tonic for mind and body.
sentences.chinese: 海上的空氣是大自然賦予的對人們身心的最佳補品。

sentences.english: Or take a bilberry supplement every morning.
As with any vitamin or supplement, please consult your doctor before taking.
sentences.chinese: 正如任何一種維生素或補品，服用前請諮詢你的醫生。

sentences.english: The whales need the nourishment, particularly when nursing their newborn calves.
sentences.chinese: 鯨需要滋補品，特別是餵養他們的幼崽時。

definition: to put on weight/to get fat
to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
woman recuperating after childbirth/woman in childbirth
to eat and eat/to stuff oneself
